definition: numeral 2 in Suzhou numeral system 蘇州碼子|苏州码子[Su1 zhou1 ma3 zi5]
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
vertical shaft (for mining, ventilation systems etc)
to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: to lie down all over the place/exhausted and in disarray
to explain sth over and over again/to repeat

sentences.english: The horse cocked its ears up several seconds before I could hear anything.
sentences.chinese: 马把耳朵竖了起来，几秒钟后，我才听到声音。

sentences.english: At the end of the day the foreman asked the first crew how many poles they had done.
sentences.chinese: 一天工作结束的时候，工头问第一组工人竖了多少根。

sentences.english: Erected in the center circle with a vertical bar disk.
sentences.chinese: 在圆周的圆心竖一根与盘面垂直的直杆。

sentences.english: Above them is a frame of beams and double wood columns.
sentences.chinese: 上面是一系列悬梁框架和竖着的双排木柱。

sentences.english: The vertical angle refers to the difference between the vertical readings.
sentences.chinese: 竖直角则是两个方向的竖盘读数之差。

sentences.english: The voice of ground crack comes from Shu's the son in the vacant land medium.
sentences.chinese: 碎裂的声音，来自竖在空地中间的那根木头桩子。

sentences.english: I've finished the crossword apart from 3 across and 10 down.
sentences.chinese: 这份纵横字谜除横3竖10以外我都填完了。

sentences.english: Let's just read the it horizontally and write it vertically.
sentences.chinese: 我们就是横着读，竖着写。

sentences.english: Like a middle finger in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 就像是欧洲的竖中指手势一样。

sentences.english: Here has also erected a Qing Dynasty inscriptions recording the matter.
sentences.chinese: 至今这里还竖有一清代碑刻记述此事。

sentences.english: They did right to put him up over a urinal : meeting of the waters.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他这座铜像竖在一座小便池上，倒是做对了。

sentences.english: On the pavement outside, there are a handful of basketball hoops and a set of rusty metal parallel bars.
sentences.chinese: 教室外面的操场竖着几个篮球架和生锈的金属双杠。

sentences.english: His hair stood on end at the sight of a snake.
sentences.chinese: 一看到蛇他头发根都竖了起来。

sentences.english: No more beef fingers, no more drama from now on, I promise.
sentences.chinese: 不再竖中指，不再闹笑话，我保证。

sentences.english: A mobile-phone mast is erected in a village.
sentences.chinese: 在一个村子里竖了一个手机信号塔。

sentences.english: The large bowlder surface of dinner table must be uplifted vertically in avoidance of breakage.
sentences.chinese: 大面积的餐台玉石面，必须竖抬，避免餐台断裂。

definition: to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
vertical/to erect/to set upright/vertical stroke in Chinese characters/young servant (old)

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
shape resembling the character 八 or 8/V-shape/splayed/figure of eight
